line.en: 'Ahem. Um...'
'Without further ado, I hereby declare the return\nof the Soaring Club!'
'Yay!'
The shouts and applause of all present echoed\nthroughout the garage.
We share a celebratory drink of juice.
'Hey!'
Everyone raises their hands and high-fives each\nother.
'We did it!'
We did it! We finally did it!
I find myself trembling with excitement.

'Okay, our next steps are the most crucial!
There's much to do before we can build a glider
and do flight training! We don't have a second to
lose!'
'Oh, that's right. Getting qualified was only the\nfirst step. Now I've got to work to improve\nmyself.'
You'll need to get much better if you really want\nto fly a newly designed aircraft.
'At any rate, Kotori, I guess it's time for you\nto resign as our president.'
'Well, now that you mention it...'
'Are you disappointed?'
'Well, I guess a little.'
'But I think I'll be much happier as club\nleader!'
'Now that you mention it, I'd rather be the club\nleader than the president,too!'
'We're back!'
'We're back!'
'Yay!'
'Sigh. Well, I guess we have reason to celebrate,\nbut still...'
'Come on. We worked over a year to achieve this.\nJust relax and enjoy the moment.'
'...Uh, would mind giving me some breathing\nroom?'
'Uh oh, you better watch out for Yoru. Few have\ngotten within a meter of her and lived to tell\nthe tale.'
'Who exactly do you think people are?'
'Ugh, I still get bullied, even though I'm the\nclub leader...'
'Ah, I'm sorry. I know this really isn't the best\ntime for this, but...'
'Kotori, I need to ask you a favor. Oh well, I\nguess everyone else can hear it too.'
'What is it?'
'What I'd like to say is... Well...'
'Kotori, I'd like you to stay as our president a\nbit longer.'
'What is this all about?'
'I ask the same of everyone. I want you all to\ncontinue calling Kotori "president" for the time\nbeing.'
A question mark appeared above the heads of all\nbut Ageha.
'That's not a problem... But why?'
'I don't want to upset Tobioka.'
I see...
'I think that Tobioka is really angry about the\nreturn of the Soaring Club.'

'That's why we should be excited. We can insist
that our club and club leader are official. This
might be just the right time to add fuel to the
flames.'
'Didn't you hear what Akari said? Some teachers\nare strongly opposed, and our club's return has\nyet to be acknowledged at a staff meeting.'
'In other words, the Soaring Club isn't back from\nthe dead quite yet.'
'I guess you're right...'
Everyone's momentary joy vanished, and their\nshoulders sagged.
'But there's a bright side as well.'
'The fact that there are some teachers who are\nopposed means that there are, in fact, more\nteachers who are in favor.'
'I see what you're getting at.'
'As long as that's case, there's still hope for\nus.'
'Yeah!'
'We definitely cannot afford to fail this time.\nTo prevent that from happening, I'm going to need\neveryone's help.'
'...That's for sure.'
Thinking about the accident last year, everyone's\nface stiffened.

'So, I think we should start by concealing our
activities for the time being and doing
everything in our power to avoid being found
out.'
'Makes sense.'
'That fact that we've borrowed this area to make\na glider must also, of course, be kept secret.'

'The less people know, the harder it will be for
others to catch wind of this, so do your best not
to mention this to anyone unless you absolutely
have to. Keep this a secret, okay?'
'You can count on me.'
'Well, I do agree that this is precisely the\nright time for us to hide our activities.'
'This is kind of exciting.'
'No complaints here.'
'I mean, I'm not even really a member, am I!?'
'Well...'
'At any rate, don't get too excited over these\nsecret, "underground", activities.'

Just having a secret base like this garage is
enough to get people riled up. Adding underground
activities to the list will only loosen their
tongues further.
That's what I really think.
First, everyone must take an oath to maintain\nsecrecy. Then we decide on a password. We will\nquietly communicate our activities through signs.
Oh, and don't even think about the old secret\nbase.

My parents are hardly fans of that half-broken,
abandoned building. So, don't tell anyone
anything about what's going on here. We'll
communicate in secret before gathering here.
Both Ageha and I already have experience doing\nthis, so underground activities shouldn't be a\nproblem.
Kotori, Asa, and Yoru should be fine as well,\nbut...
'I get it! I won't tell a soul about the new\nglider we're building here.'
A damp silence fell over everyone, including\nmyself.
...The least reliable to consult with in the\nclub... Who could it be...?
'Well, even if that's the case!'
Ageha was the first to recover.
'Let's go all out in our activities!'
'All out? People still say that?'
'If you hesitate, you lose!'
'Well then everyone. From now on, I'm going to\nforce you to work until there's nothing left of\nyou!'
'Umm, club leader, I...'
'It's nothing! Don't worry!'
Ageha flicked her hair back and winked.
As her hair flowed from side to side, I found\nmyself lost in her eyes.
'...What are you looking at?'
'Oh my, what's going on?'
Well, compared to Amane-senpai, Ageha still has\nways to go.
'Huh? I suddenly feel like I'm being watched.'
'What're ya' talkin' about? (<-- like this?^^)'
'I'll give you the appropriate amount of\npunishment for this transgression later.'
'I have no idea what that means, but I can't say\nI'm in any hurry to find out.'
Punishment!
That was a word known only to us that referred to\nthe consequence of a terrifying game in which the\nloser is to be punished!
By the way, the game's contents proceed in\nseverity from ritual suicide to punishment, just\nso you know.
Though I have to admit that 'ritual suicide' does\nsound kind of stupid.
The point of 'punishment' is, that it only became\na game because the words An-chan wrote for us\nwere difficult and cool.
Punishment... How nostalgic...
'...Shivers...Sorry, sorry, sorry!'
'Huh? Aoi here is pale and shaking like a piglet\nabout to be roasted over an open flame.'
'Uh, oh, hmm...'
'I hope that I've made myself clear.'
'Even if we plan to keep things low, I still\nexpect the same amount of effort as always.'
'Arrangements must be made for the aircraft's\nproduction, FRP construction, acquisition of\nparts and collection of weather data.'
'It'll be tough! We're going to have to work\nhard!'
'But we'll get it done! It's the only way for us\nto achieve our dream! Let's get to it!'
'Oh!'
'I, the club leader...'
...Well, I suppose that's it.
The new Soaring Club had begun working quietly,\nbut actively, to achieve its goals...
'Well then!'
Ageha put her hand and fist together.
'Put your backs into it! Let's do this!'
The dazzling aura emitted by Ageha at this moment\nwas obvious to all of us.
It was overwhelming.
Not even Kotori could resist its power.
'Her energy levels are over 9000!'
'Enough talking!'
'This time we'll protect it!'
'The club?'
'The club and this place!'
Ageha raised both arms, showing off her\nauthority.
'Our new secret base will be our playground!'
'We may have lost our old secret base, but this\ntime we'll keep our base safe!'
'And we'll all work together to do what's right!'
Ageha held her fist out firmly in front of her.
It seemed like nothing special, but... something\nhot struck me in the chest with a thud.
And then, I...
'Okay! Sorry to keep you waiting!'
Eat! Eat! Eat as much as you want!
'Dig in!'
'Don't mind if I do!'
'Let's eat!'
Food is a source of power. Eat well, make\nyourself strong, and get yourself ready to move\ntomorrow!
'Munch munch munch, chomp chomp chomp.'
'Chew chew chew, munch munch munch.'
'I want seconds!'
'Me too!'
'Eat! Eat and eat more! Eat till you burst!'
'...Hey guys, what's wrong?'
'Summer's here and it's hot!'
'Sweltering is more like it...'
'Don't worry! Summer is supposed to be hot!'
'...Ah, yes, that was good. Congratulations.'
'Thank you very much!'
'You've really got the eye of the tiger, don't\nyou?'
'Enough already!'
Kotori and the rest nodded at my answer.
The temperature was clearly different between\nother students and those of us in the Soaring\nClub.
But that's how it goes!
Even after finishing my usual work and returning\nto my room, I find myself unable to stay still.
It's Ageha's fault.
She got so excited... It must have rubbed off on\nme.
Ageha was absolutely stunning at that moment.
Her eyes were dazzling and her form radiant.
Just thinking about it made my eyes close in\nsweet remembrance.
I...I must have felt the same thing back then...
When nobody could get me off my bike...
'...I won't lose.'
I began polishing my bike by the wall with a rag.
Whether it could be ridden or not was of no\nconcern to me.
I just wanted to clean it up a bit.
I didn't want to be embarrassed the next time I\ntake it out.
Morning.
As always, I waited for Ageha to come, pushed\nKotori's wheelchair, and went with everyone to\nschool.
'Mornin'!'
'Yep.'
'Uh, erm... Good morning...'
'Oh, it's you, Hotaru. Long time no see.'
'Go with Hotaru today. I have to leave a bit\nearlier than usual.'
'Ah, could that mean... Oh, she's already gone.'
'Umm... I'm not an annoyance, am I?'
'Oh no, it's not that at all... It's just...'
'Did Ageha mention anything to you?'
'Ageha... She just said I should go to school\nwith you. That's all...'
'I see. It'd be nice if she would have explained\nherself.'
Anyway, we're running late, so I'll explain\neverything to you on the go.
'Did you hear about the return of the Soaring\nClub?'
'Yes.'
'It's back, but Tobioka is keeping an eye on us,\nso we're trying to be inconspicuous.'
'Ageha probably thinks that it's not a good idea\nto have the members gather and go to school\ntogether with everyone all excited about it.'
'That makes so much sense. Ageha sure is smart.'
'I'm not sure about that...'
'Are you sure I'm not... annoying you?'
'No, not at all. I need the company.'
'Oh, that, that...'
'What?'
'I don't know what to say. It makes me feel kind\nof ticklish inside.'
'It tickles if I say that.'
'If you do it, it's like punishment.'
'Uh huh... despite the fact that you don't even\nknow what that means...'
'Um, does it mean you're going to tie her up and\ntickle the bottom of her feet until she squeals\nlike a little piggy?!'
Hotaru, please report to the staff room later.
'Uh oh...'
'Oh boy...'
'That's the past! The past! I was still in shorts\nfor crying out loud!'
'On the contrary, I was the one who did stuff\nback then!'
'Argh!'
'I wonder what you'd say to describe something\nthat is lower than the lowest?'
'Heresy.'
'Terrible heresy.'
'Are you taking me for a ride!?'
'Hehehe.'
'...I kind of like going to school with you,\nAoi.'
'What exactly is there to enjoy about this\nconversation...?'
Tobioka was standing near the school gate.
He had a terrible look in his eyes when he saw\nus.

However, when he realized that the Kazato sisters
were a bit apart from each other and the
wheelchair-bound Kotori wasn't with Ageha, he
seemed confused.
'Huh.'
'For God's sake.'
'Good morning.'
'... Oh, good morning.'
At any rate, we couldn't show our blunt animosity\nin front of Hotaru.
I guess this means that Ageha's plan is working.
'Well, I guess I'll see you after school.'
'At club activities.'
'Oh.'
'Okay Aoi, Kotori, I'll see you later.'
'Sure. Thanks for today.'
Hotaru smiled happily and skipped up the stairs.
'...Cute kid, now that I see her again.'
'That's right. You two have rarely met each other\nin person.'
'Would you not talk to me like I'm some sort of\nchallenger?'
'Forgive me, princess!'
'Enough of that already.'
'Well, there hasn't been much contact, that's\nall.'
'Haven't you been longtime friends, the same as\nwith Ageha or Tasaki?'
'Ah, yeah, but she's younger, so we never played\nin the same way and she would always just follow\nus around.'
'I see... So that's how it is.'
'Hmm? What do you mean?'
'The way that little one looks at you is similar\nto how a young chick looks at a parent.'
'Ah... well, you may be right about that.'
Which reminds me, long ago, like Hotaru, there\nwere many more people besides Ageha accompanying\nme.
I guess she got attached to me somehow... but\nthat's all I can say.
'Hmm, I wonder why Ageha left before us today.'
'Good point, I never asked.'
Until last year, she would head to the garage\nearly under the guise of going to her sport\nclub's morning practice.
Because our new secret base is on the other side\nof the lake, that's no longer possible.
That, too, is bound to become a problem.
'What is this?'
Both my desk and Kotori's had envelopes in them.
'...Mission?'
'MISSION: Find the following parts! Just so you\nknow, you are to find them with Hotaru.'
Also, in the corner was written a strange symbol\nthat looked like an 8 on its side, a  that\nappeared to have antennas attached to it.
'...Umm... Perhaps this is supposed to be a\nswallowtail butterfly.'
A feeling of fatigue fell over me.
'I, as always... will work hard on building the\nstructure.'
'I think you'll find me spending less time at\nclub activities for a while, so I hope I have\nyour permission to be absent, club leader.'
'What's this all about?'
I saw no sign of Ageha in the classroom.
And then she appeared.
'Is that so? I see, I see.'
...She was with a girl I'd never seen before.
They talked to each other near the entrance.
'Who is that?'
'No idea...'
She goes to the same school, so I know I've seen\nher around before.
But until now I've never seen her with Ageha... I\nhaven't seen her in the Robot Club either...
'Well then, see you again at lunch!'
With a smile, Ageha saw the girl off and entered\nthe room.
'Hey... So did Tobioka say anything?'
'Ah... well.'
'Who is that girl you were just with?'
'Oh, she's in the Astronomy Club.'
'Astronomy? So are you asking her for weather\ndata or something?'
'Of course I am. But that's not all.'
'What do you mean by that?'
'I'm keeping it secret for now. Still don't know\nhow it will turn out.'
'What does that mean? Tell us more.'
'Well, umm...'
'Never mind that, let's talk about this\nmission...'
'Grrr...'
Ageha raised her finger and waved it backed and\nforth.
'We can't talk about our duties in public.'
'Haven't you seen this sort of thing in movies?'
'It's common sense for even the most stupid of\nintelligence officers.'
'Ah, okay okay.'
'Your lack of enthusiasm troubles me.'
'Is including Hotaru meant to be a foil against\nTobioka?'
'She shows good judgment and should be of help.'
'I doubt you'll mind having a cute young girl,\nwho looks just like me, along with you, would\nyou?'
'I can only get behind the 'cute' part.'
'Ouch, that stings.'
'To put it differently, it's especially your\nintonation that's troubling.'
'That really hurts!'
'Anyway, we should go buy these and bring them\nback to you.'
'And don't forget the receipt. Thanks!'
Ageha's tone returned to normal.
Well then, it'll have to wait until after school.
To complete Ageha's mission, we'll have to invite\nHotaru.
But she's in a lower grade classroom...
This might end up being more than a little\nembarrassing.
'Umm... Aoi.'
'Oh, Hotaru?'
'Ageha, today...'
'Oh, I understand. No need to say anything more.'
'She asked me to ask you to escort me.'
'Though we already told her okay.'
'But will you really do it?'
'...It's me who should ask. Is it okay with you?'
'Of course.'
...People must have been passing by as we talked.
'Oh hey, Minase, you with Himegi again?'
'Ugh, that lucky bum.'
'Hey hey, don't say th...'
Oh, but if you think of our objective, wouldn't\nit be better if outsiders... misunderstood?
You'll better not deny it for now.
...Maybe I made the wrong choice... I don't\nreally feel that way, but...
'Well, I umm...'
'Ah, shall we go?'
I smiled.
Hotaru couldn't be more innocent if she tried.
'Okay.'
And so... we started walking.
I walk.
Hotaru stumbles after me.
Even outside, nothing changes.
'Umm... ahhh...'
'Yes?'
'Shouldn't we be walking together like normal\npeople?'
'I am, am I not?'
She looked slightly doubtful.
'Ah... well, whatever.'
'It's not like that. You don't have to walk\nbehind me.'
Hotaru's eyes widened, and she let out a strange\nvoice.
'No, it's not that it's bad necessarily...'
'I don't feel comfortable if I'm walking with\nsomeone behind me.'
'What if I just like watching you from behind?'
'Well, uh, that'd be nice and all, but...'
'Your back has gotten really big.'
'Umm, thanks...'
It's kind of hard to explain, but I suddenly felt\nan attack of discomfort.
It was sort of an itchy or ticklish feeling...
My face deformed effortlessly and stiffened into\na smile.
'Maybe it's because of all of the bike riding...'
'Maybe.'
That made Hotaru smile.
Remembering my strange heartbeat, I frantically\nturned forwards.
'Anyway, I am not going to be able to settle down\nlike this,so I want us to walk side by side when\nwe're walking together...'
'Okay.'
The sound of footsteps caught up to me.
I walk slowly to match the delicate movements of\nher legs.
Ugh... I'm not sure how much longer I can keep\nthis up...
'Huh... this somehow feels natural... my heart is\npounding.'
'Oh yeah, right.'
'But I'm a little scared.'
'Scared?'
'Having nobody in front of me. It feels kind of\nstrange...'
'Shouldn't you already be used to that by now?'
'It's fine when I'm alone. But when I'm with\nyou...'
I felt a sudden tightness.
In my legs.
My pants suddenly seemed tight and suffocating.
'...Is something wrong? '
The eyes that looked up at me were shaken and\nmoist with tears.
I can't believe that'd be enough to make her cry.
'It's nothing.'
It's not like we don't know each other.
Even if we're seen by others... It's not right\nfor me to be cold, not even to Hotaru.
'Well, let's get going. Ageha is going to be\nfurious if the shopping alone takes the whole\nday.'
'Yes. Ageha as full of motivation as a balloon\nright now. Poke her the wrong way, and she might\npop.'
'...Ah, you're sisters, aren't you?'
The way they express themselves is the same.
But, now that I think about it...
Whenever Hotaru's been around, I've always been\nwith Ageha... and whenever Ageha is not around,\nHotaru isn't either.
In other words, I've never actually been\ncompletely alone with Hotaru up until now.
Even though it's been over a year since I came\nback, how could I have not realized this before\nnow?!
What I should say.
I don't want to come across as strange.
'Umm, uh...'
'What?'
'You're aren't unhappy being with me, are you?'
'It's not like that.'
'I mean, I'm not as strong as Ageha. I'm not\nreally good at conversation either.'
'That's not important. Just be yourself.'
'I don't do silly things like Ageha, and I'm not\nslightly offbeat in a way that inspires to\nlaugh.'
'...But you are kind of dark, aren't you?'
'If... it's you, it's okay, but...'
'This is my first time to walk like this with\nanother boy... I'm a bit nervous.'
'Oh, I see.'
'You're cute and the type of girl a boyfriend\nwould want to protect, I'm sure you'd have no\nproblems getting one.'
'Masatsugu has no trouble being positive. Surely,\nyou too...'
'...I have no boyfriend and I can't get one. Boys\nare scary, after all. '
'Because they're rude?'
'Because they're big.'
Well, I suppose that, compared to her, most guys\nseem quite large.
'But when I'm pedaling for my life, I shout like\na madman with a look of pure intensity on my\nface.'
'Biking?'
'Right, biking. Like, when I'm competing. When I\nsaw a photograph of me at full speed, I was\nshocked. It was really something.'
'I want to see it.'
'No way. I'm keeping that hidden for as long as I\nlive.'
'But I really want to see it.'
'No means no.'
'My eyes are bloodshot, my teeth grit, and the\nvessels in my neck are popping out. I'm more of a\nmonster than a man. I'm really terrifying.'
'I'll see for myself.'
'Even though I warned you it was scary.'
'If its a picture of you, it can't be scary.'
'Don't be so sure. The guy competing with me\nlooked like a gorilla.'
'Now that's scary. Cut that part of the photo\nout.'
'Don't be foolish.'
'Then show me.'
'You're are quite stubborn, aren't you?'
'Yes.'
Hotaru nodded in defiance
'Would you show it to your girlfriend?'
'I thought you might ask that.'
Revenge for before.
'I don't have one. A girl to call my own...'
'Oh.'
She seemed to enjoy hearing that.
'So, you don't have one.'
'Ah, no, I don't.'
'And you didn't have one?'
'No, I didn't.'
My heart suddenly felt a bit hollow.
'I see. So you didn't have one, and you don't\nhave one right now.'
'Well, what about Ageha?'
'No... Why are you asking about Ageha?'
'You don't like her?'
'No... it's not that. I've just never thought\nabout it before...'
'Never?'
'Rather than... never. What should I say...?'
Well... I did confess my feelings for her long\nago...
In the 5 years in between that we weren't able to\nspend together...
...Right...
This year we've been hanging out as much as we\nused to.
My feelings toward Ageha haven't changed that\nmuchfrom before.
Haven't... in the past tense...
We did a lot together and often found ourselves\nalone. We've been close to each other and have\nshared so many experiences...
But I'm really sure that none of that ever\ncreated a new spark between us.
'I haven't.'
'Haven't, you say.'
'Yeah.'
'I see.'
As if responding to not me but herself, Hotaru\nnodded weakly.
Her face really looks like Ageha's.
'...You really do look alike, don't you?'
'I look like Ageha?'
'Yeah.'
'I wonder...'
'You may have your differences, but even a blind\nman could tell that you're sisters.'
'I get that a lot.'
Hotaru's cheeks reddened a little.
'Huh? What's wrong?'
'You... stared at me... so I feel embarrassed...'
'Oh, I'm sorry.'
'Apologize.'
'Huh?'
'Touch my cheek. Like in the old days...'
'Sure.'
Without resisting, I placed my hand on Hotaru's\nface.
And just like that, I started to move it gently\nacross her face.
Hotaru's eyes closed as if she were in a trance.
My finger became entangled in her hair.
So fine and so soft.
This is completely different from my thick, rough\nhair.
'How was that?'
'Okay.'
Hotaru nodded her head in satisfaction.
Perhaps for lack of better judgment, Hotaru's\nfacial expression softened after that.
...We arrive at our destination.

This is a specialty shop that deals in business
materials. Tools and supplies can be purchased
here at prices lower than are found at your
average home center.
An-chan told me that the parts needed for the\nglider can be purchased from here.
Hotaru must find a supply shop such as this\namazing. She spoke louder than usual and looked\naround restlessly.
'Umm, we requested wire, oil, and 5 paint\nbrushes...'
We purchased everything on Ageha's memo and\nheaded for the door.
Don't take the materials to school, take them\nhere.
I look around, keeping a close eye on the school\non the other side of the lake.
If someone were looking at us with binoculars,\nI'm sure that the rays of sunlight would be\nreflecting off of them.
Okay, I think the coast is clear.
'...What are you doing?'
'I'm on the look out. We'd be in trouble if\nTobioka were to find us.'
'Hmm, I see. I'll look too.'
We strained our eyes and began looking around\nrestlessly.
'No, no, it's fine.'
I stroked her head again.
'Ahh.'
That groan itself was cute enough to make me want\nto stroke her more.
'No more... your kiss...'
'I should know better than this.'
'We bought what you wanted.'
'Good work.'
'Huh, where is Ageha?'
'She said she wouldn't be able to come by for a\nwhile.'
'Oh, is that so?'
'I wonder what she's up to.'
'It's kind of troubling isn't it? Without Ageha,\nI don't know if even I have the confidence to\nbuild anything.'
Asa and Yoru are over there practicing how to\nmake places for FRP as usual.
'...Oooooh!'
Oh that's right. It's Hotaru's first time here.
With a voice far larger than in the shop we\nvisited earlier, her eyes and mouth were perfect\ncircles as she looked around the garage.
'This is amazing! So this is the new Soaring\nClub's base of operations! This is the place that\npromises to return us to the air!'
'Stop that. It's embarrassing.'
'What's wrong? It's the truth, isn't it?'
'I agree with Aoi.'
'Just thinking about it gives me goose bumps.'
'Am I surrounded by enemies on all sides? '
'I... personally enjoy that sort of thing.'
'Well... well, well, well!'
Kotori's face suddenly brightened.
I had never seen Kotori's face seem so bright and\nso kind before.
'You really understand!'
'Yes. I think it's wonderful.'
'That turns the tables!'
'Nope, it's still 3 versus 2, and even then,\nHotaru isn't a member.'
'Hotaru Himegi! We in the new Soaring Club await\nyour membership!'
'If you join now, your leader, Kotori Habane,\nwill personally teach you how to make a glider!'
'But only Kotori can teach you.. we only work in\nFRP.'
'Amane is in charge of design, Ageha is in charge\nof production and supply, and Aoi is our pilot.'
'How mean!'
'Well... C'mon, get over it.'
'You won't even come to my aid? '
'I've seen the strong friendships you all share.\nBut it seems that every single bit of it is\nnothing more than an illusion. '
'That's not true!'
Hotaru is unexpectedly harsh, isn't she?
Well, she is Ageha's sister after all.
'Thank you for waiting! I'm here at last!'
'Waaaaaah!?'
'What is that all about?'
'Nothing... actually, your timing couldn't have\nbeen better...'
'My timing?'
Ageha looked around at everyone without a shred\nof concern.
'Oh, Hotaru. You're here. Good job with the\nsupplies!'
'Over.'
She raised two fingers into a peace sign.
Ageha made scissors out of her fingers and\npinched Hotaru's finger.
Could this be a greeting between sisters? It\nlooks like some sort of promise ritual.
'As usual, I've been checking up on things.'
'Like what? '
'Like Aoi's actions.'
Everybody froze in place, even Kotori.
'What? It's not that big of a deal.'
'I just heard from Ryouko that Aoi and Hotaru\nhave been walking together.'
'Kids who are into that sort of gossip can't get\nenough.'
'It's only a matter of time before someone close\nto Tobioka catches wind of all this.'
'So that's what this is about... you had me there\nfor a minute.'
I thought she had maybe bugged us and had been\nfollowing us around.
'As I predicted, it appears that we'll need to be\nmore careful due to Tobioka's resistance.'
'That's why we need to be careful for now.'
'We aren't doing this to outwit Tobioka. We're\ndoing this to fly. Don't forget that.'
Kotori and I looked at each other and laughed out\nloud.
'...Ummm, who are you talking to?'
'Unbelievable. Wouldn't putting this much blood,\nsweat, and tears into getting back at Tobioka be\nabout as useful as a runway mower?'
Geez, you don't understand anything, Ageha.
Having heard those words, Ageha smiled happily.
'Well, I wasn't really worried about it. I just\nthought it was better to say it.'
'I get it. I'll be sure to steer clear of\nTobioka.'
'Damn... We missed our chance.'
...Ageha was right to worry.
'By the way, what were you two doing?'
'Well, I did what I was told!'
Ta-dah!' Ageha showed us a transparent box while\nholding it high.
It was a case. 30cm on all sides and transparent.
And inside the case...
'Wow!'
'Oh!'
A white airplane.
It's the new glider that we're making!
This model.
It was splendidly made and looked like it could\nfly as it is.
'The Model Research Society. I gave them some\ndata in exchange for this.'

'Naturally, one should go to the masters if they
want the best. Isn't it great? Even the finest
details on the wings were made with expert
precision!'
'We can use this model for test flights. We'll\nuse a miniature wind tunnel for our experiments!'
An unusual desk fan and an enclosed plastic board\nhave been shown to us.
'With this, we can do a variety of tests with the\nminiature version of our new glider!'
'...That's great, but... Are you sure you know\nwhat you're doing?'
'I swear I didn't tell another soul about our\nplans!'
'They'd probably sing our praises!'
'I simply provided them with the data they\nwanted.'
'I got this miniature wind tunnel from the\nPhysics lab. I was sure to keep my true intent a\nsecret.'
'...Amazing...'
'My networking efforts aren't just for show.'
'...I, the club leader...'
'Good luck Kotori!'
'It's often said that those who work under their\nsuperiors are more capable and perform better\nwhen it comes to the actual work.'
'Nooooooo!'
'No no, Kotori, you're needed.'
'You want to fly more than anyone.'
'And it's that passion that guides us!'
'Well, I suppose, I am the club leader, which, in\nturn, makes me the leader!'
'That's right! Kotori's the leader, and I'm just\nan ordinary member! Thanks to you, I, too, can do\nmy very best!'
'That's right! Go for it club leader!'
Kotori did not seem entirely satisfied.
...Well, no need to over do it.
'But Ageha, this is really something.'
I picked up the model and observed it from a\nvariety of angles.
The more I looked at it, the more perfect it\nappeared.
'The only thing I'm nervous about is the data.'
'Who knows if we'll have time to test the real\nthing after it's complete.'
'I thought we'd at least do what we can.'
'I don't want us to have any regrets.'
'...That makes sense. '
Like Kotori, I again felt overwhelmed.

Ageha's spirit, energy, and drive. That feeling
was the feeling to keep moving forward. The
overwhelming determination to finish glider, no
matter the cost.
We were all consumed by it.
Are we not just piling up losses!?
There were absolutely no developments last year,\nand we didn't get far. That strange phenomenon,\nthe cloud cloister, the "Morning Glory".
I'm the one who should fly through it.
This is the glider of my dreams.
It's been a year since last year's failure, and\nthis has become my dream of dreams.
'Ageha!'
'Wha?! What!?'
'I'm going to fly! You have my word!'
'What's wrong with you? Where did this come\nfrom?'
'It's okay! I'm the one who wants to fly!'
'You're so strange...'
'But... my heart is in the right place! I'll do\nit!'
I held out my hand.
Ageha swung her arm and our hands met for a loud\nhigh-five.
'...Well, and there we have it. We've created the\nperfect setting!'
'That's great. Now get the rest of us involved.'
'You shouldn't leave anybody out. Ah, but I guess\nI'm not a member yet, am I?'
'Well then, take it away, advisor Amane!'
'Okay.'
'What!?'
Amane is here!?
'You sure are motivated, aren't you?'
'Yes!'
'You all must combine your strength and continue\nworking towards your goal. Yes, that's what's\nbest.'
'In the meantime, let me know if there's anything\nI can do. I'll help as much as I can.'

'Well but... the interference issue is still
unresolved... it's all calculations; aside from
the windmill's rotation and vibration... mutter
mutter'
'Sigh...'
As usual, motivation one second, nothing the\nnext.
The motivation in the room faded away in instant.
In it's place, the natural temperature returned\nand the damp feeling of humidity, so common right\nbefore midsummer, took over.
'Huh? What's wrong everyone?'
'Nothing...'
Everyone looked as if they had swallowed poison,\neven Ageha. That feeling alone was enough to\nadjourn the meeting.
'How was it, Hotaru?'
'What do you mean?'
'Your date with Aoi.'
'Hey!'
'You may not think Aoi has the guts to do\nanything, but if anything strange happens, tell\nme rather than just go along with it.'
'Is that how you think of other people?!'
'Tell me immediately if he bullies you. I'll let\nhim taste of three running dropkicks if he does.'
'What the hell?!'
'Hehehe. Don't confuse the old me with the person\nwho stands before you now!'
'The old Ageha?'
'That's a good question. So, I'll answer. Long\nago in this town existed Ageha-don, a large\nmonster that brought this town to its knees.'
'It's height was 158 centimeters, and it's weight\na secret. It was beautiful and fit. It bit off\nAoi's head and... gulp.'
'She ate it...'
'She ate it, right?'
'Yes, she swallowed it.'
'This is getting kind of inappropriate.'
'She rolled it in her mouth, she licked it and\nsucked on it, and at the end she gulped this\ndelicious thing down...'
'Aoi's... licking, sucking, and gulping down...'
'Now this is extremely vulgar.'
'...So, quit it already Aoi!'
'How's this my fault!?'
'That's right, it's your fault. You've got a\ndirty mind.'
'Aoi is a perv...'
'Where did that come from!?'
'What were we talking about again?'
'Heeeeeeey!'
'Aoi is a perv... Aoi is a perv... Aoi is a\nperv...'
'Leave me alone!'
'Hotaru, you shouldn't say too much.'
'Got it!'
Ah, I just love being used as a human punchbag.
'Thanks to you as well, Aoi. Your anti-Tobioka\ncamouflage tactics were a huge success!'
'Camouflage, you say...'
I could feel Hotaru's eyes on me.
Aware of the indifference in Ageha's voice, I\nwalked off.
Ageha's strategy was hardly a mistake. That much\nI know.
However, I found that I couldn't help... but feel\ndepressed.
